intro: Bupleurum parnassicum, commonly known as the alpine bupleurum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and often fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Bupleurum parnassicum is valued for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
